providers.title: Providers
providers.noProvidersDesc: No package providers are registered in the system.
providers.noResultsDesc: Try adjusting your search query or filters to find providers.
providers.checkStatusDesc: Check if this provider is available on the system
providers.checkAllStatusDesc: Check availability status for all providers
providers.infoText: Providers are adapters that connect CogniaLauncher to various package managers and environment tools. Each provider handles specific functionality:
providers.infoEnvironmentDesc: nvm, pyenv, rustup, phpbrew, dotnet - Manage runtime versions with multi-version support and project-local configuration.
providers.infoJsPackageDesc: npm, pnpm, yarn, bun - Manage Node.js packages globally with version locking and update checking.
providers.infoPyPackageDesc: pip, uv, poetry - Python package management with virtual environment support and dependency resolution.
providers.infoRustPackageDesc: Cargo - Install and manage Rust crates and binary packages.
providers.infoRubyPackageDesc: Bundler - Manage Ruby gems and dependencies with Gemfile support.
providers.infoJavaDesc: SDKMAN!, Adoptium - Manage JDK versions (Temurin, Corretto, etc.), Kotlin, Scala, Groovy compilers, and build tools (Gradle, Maven) with multi-version support and .sdkmanrc project-local configuration.
providers.infoPhpPackageDesc: Composer - PHP dependency management with Packagist integration.
providers.infoDotnetPackageDesc: .NET SDK - Manage NuGet packages and .NET SDK versions with global.json support.
providers.infoSystemDesc: apt, Homebrew, winget, Scoop, Chocolatey - Interface with OS-level package managers for system software.
providers.infoCppDesc: vcpkg, Conan, Xmake/Xrepo, MSVC, MSYS2 - Manage C/C++ libraries across platforms with dependency resolution and binary caching. Detect system compilers (GCC/Clang), Visual Studio Build Tools, and MSYS2/MinGW toolchains. Project-level C++ standard detection from CMakeLists.txt, meson.build, and xmake.lua.
providers.infoDartDesc: FVM, Dart Pub - Flutter SDK version management and pub.dev package management with dependency resolution.
providers.infoLuaDesc: LuaRocks - Install and manage Lua rocks (modules) with dependency resolution and rockspec support.
providers.infoContainerDesc: Docker, Podman - Manage container images with pull, list, and update functionality. Podman provides daemonless, rootless container management.
providers.infoPowershellDesc: PSGallery - Install and manage PowerShell modules from the gallery.
providers.infoCustomDesc: GitHub - Fetch and install packages from GitHub releases.
providers.infoWslDesc: Windows Subsystem for Linux - Install, manage, and configure Linux distributions on Windows.

cache.title: Cache
cache.clearConfirmDesc: This will remove all cached files. Downloaded packages will need to be re-downloaded.
cache.clearDownloadConfirmDesc: This will remove all downloaded package files. They will need to be re-downloaded when needed.
cache.clearMetadataConfirmDesc: This will remove all cached metadata. Package information will be re-fetched when needed.
cache.clearAllConfirmDesc: This will remove all cached data including downloads and metadata. Everything will need to be re-downloaded.
cache.verifySuccess: Cache verification complete - no issues found
cache.maxSizeDesc: Maximum cache storage size in MB
cache.resolveStrategyDesc: How versions are resolved when multiple are available
cache.autoUpdateMetadataDesc: Automatically refresh package metadata in the background
cache.previewDesc: The following {type} files will be cleaned
cache.useTrashDesc: Files will be moved to system trash and can be recovered later
cache.permanentDeleteDesc: Files will be permanently deleted and cannot be recovered
cache.hitRateDesc: Percentage of cache requests that found cached data
cache.browseEntriesDesc: View and manage individual cache entries
cache.warningHigh: Cache usage is at {percent}%. Consider cleaning up to free space.
cache.warningCritical: Cache usage is critical at {percent}%! Clean up immediately to avoid issues.
cache.externalCachesDesc: Manage caches from package managers and development tools
cache.noExternalCaches: No external caches found or no tools installed
cache.externalCleanAllDesc: This will clean caches from {count} package managers. This action cannot be undone.
cache.sizeMonitorDesc: Real-time cache size monitoring and threshold alerts
cache.thresholdExceeded: Cache usage ({percent}%) exceeds threshold ({threshold}%). Auto-cleanup will trigger.
cache.pathManagementDesc: View and manage cache storage location
cache.migrationDesc: Move cache data to a new location
cache.migrationModeMoveDesc: Move files to new location and update config path
cache.migrationModeMoveAndLinkDesc: Move files and create symlink at original location
cache.migrationSuccess: Cache migration completed successfully! Moved {size} ({count} files)
cache.forceCleanDesc: Force clean all internal caches (ignores age/size limits)
cache.forceCleanConfirmDesc: This will delete ALL cached data regardless of age or size limits. This cannot be undone.
cache.forceCleanExternalConfirm: Force clean {provider} cache? This will use direct deletion to remove all cached files.
cache.autoCleanThresholdDesc: Trigger auto-cleanup when cache usage exceeds this percentage (0 = disabled)
cache.monitorIntervalDesc: How often to check cache size (seconds, 0 = disabled)
cache.monitorExternalDesc: Include external tool caches in monitoring
cache.optimizeDesc: Run VACUUM and ANALYZE to reclaim unused space and improve performance
cache.noSizeHistory: No size history data yet. Snapshots are recorded automatically.
cache.externalPathsDesc: Detailed path information for all external cache providers

wsl.highRiskHint: This is a high-risk operation. Administrator privileges may be required, and unexpected interruptions can cause data issues.
wsl.capabilityUnsupported: Feature '{feature}' is unavailable on this system (WSL {version}).
wsl.dataLossWarning: Warning: This action will permanently delete all data in the distribution.

preset.vpnOptimizedDesc: Mirrored networking + DNS tunneling + auto proxy + firewall. Best for VPN and corporate networks.
preset.developerDesc: Full mirrored networking + host loopback + sparse VHD + gradual memory reclaim. Ideal for development workflows.
preset.classicNatDesc: Standard NAT networking with localhost forwarding. Compatible with all Windows versions.

config.title: .wslconfig Settings
config.restartNote: Changes require WSL restart (wsl --shutdown) to take effect.
config.presetApplied: Network preset applied. Restart WSL to take effect.
config.processorsDesc: Number of processors for WSL2 VM
config.autoMemoryReclaimDesc: Auto-release unused memory (gradual, dropCache, or disabled)
config.sparseVhdDesc: Automatically reclaim disk space from virtual hard disks
config.dnsTunnelingDesc: Enable DNS tunneling for improved DNS resolution
config.firewallDesc: Apply Windows Firewall rules to WSL
config.dnsProxyDesc: Configure DNS proxy for NAT networking mode
config.autoProxyDesc: Automatically inherit Windows proxy and VPN settings
config.hostAddressLoopbackDesc: Allow WSL2 to connect to Windows localhost services in mirrored mode

exec.title: Execute Command
exec.noRunningHint: No distributions are running. Commands may start the distribution automatically.

wsl.importInPlaceDesc: Import an existing .vhdx file directly as a new distribution (ext4 formatted)
wsl.name: Name
wsl.moveConfirm: Move '{name}' to a new location? This may take a long time and should not be interrupted.
wsl.resizeConfirm: Resize virtual disk for '{name}'? Ensure enough host disk space before continuing.
wsl.mountDesc: Mount a physical or virtual disk in all WSL2 distributions
wsl.mountConfirm: Mount this disk in WSL now? This may require administrator privileges.
wsl.diskPathOptional: Disk Path (leave empty to unmount all)
wsl.mountAsVhdConfirm: Is this a virtual disk file (.vhd/.vhdx)?
wsl.mountPartitionInvalid: Partition number must be a positive integer.
wsl.mountOptionsFallback: Current WSL does not advertise mount --options support; continuing without it.
wsl.changeDefaultUserDesc: Set the default login user for this distribution

distroConfig.title: Distribution Config
distroConfig.empty: No wsl.conf settings configured for this distribution
distroConfig.restartNote: Changes require distribution restart (wsl --terminate) to take effect.
distroConfig.systemdDesc: Boot with systemd as init system
distroConfig.interopDesc: Allow running Windows executables from Linux
distroConfig.automountRootDesc: Root directory for Windows drive mounts (default: /mnt/)
distroConfig.generateHostsDesc: Automatically generate /etc/hosts with Windows hostname mappings
distroConfig.hostnameDesc: Custom hostname for this distribution (empty = auto)
distroConfig.appendWindowsPathDesc: Add Windows PATH entries to Linux $PATH
distroConfig.gpuEnabledDesc: Allow Linux apps to access the Windows GPU via para-virtualization

detail.notFound: Distribution '{name}' not found. It may have been unregistered.
detail.terminalEmpty: Execute commands in this distribution. Type a command above and press Enter.
detail.filesystemHint: Click Browse or press Enter to load a directory.
detail.networkNotRunning: Start the distribution to view network information.
detail.servicesNotRunning: Start the distribution to view services.
detail.noSystemd: Systemd is not enabled for this distribution. Enable it in the Overview tab under Distribution Config.
detail.envDetectFailed: Could not detect environment (distribution may not be running)

dialog.changeUserDesc: Select or enter a username to set as the default login user for this distribution.
dialog.mountDesc: Attach a physical or virtual disk to all WSL2 distributions.
dialog.moveDesc: Move the distribution's virtual disk to a new location on your host filesystem.
dialog.moveWarning: This operation may take a long time and should not be interrupted. Ensure the target has enough free space.
dialog.resizeDesc: Set a new maximum size for the distribution's virtual hard disk.
dialog.importInPlaceDesc: Register an existing ext4-formatted .vhdx file directly as a new WSL distribution.

launch.title: Launch
launch.description: Launch programs with specific environment versions

shim.title: Shims
shim.description: Manage binary shims for environment tools

pathManagement.title: PATH Management
pathManagement.description: Manage the shim directory in your system PATH
pathManagement.notInPath: Shim directory is not in PATH
pathManagement.setupDescription: Add the shim directory to your system PATH so shims can be used globally
pathManagement.addCommandDescription: Run this command to manually add the shim directory to PATH
pathManagement.restartRequired: You may need to restart your terminal for changes to take effect

onboarding.wizardDesc: Let's get CogniaLauncher set up for you
onboarding.welcomeDesc: Your all-in-one environment and package manager. Let's walk through a quick setup to get you started.
onboarding.welcomeHint: This will only take a minute
onboarding.languageDesc: Select your preferred language. You can change this anytime in Settings.
onboarding.themeDesc: Pick a look that suits you. This can be changed later in Settings.
onboarding.envDetectionDesc: We'll scan your system for installed development tools and runtimes.
onboarding.envWebModeNote: Full detection is available in the desktop app. Web mode shows limited results.
onboarding.mirrorsDesc: Choose a mirror preset for faster package downloads based on your region.
onboarding.mirrorsChinaPresetDesc: Use optimized mirrors for faster access in China
onboarding.mirrorsCustomDesc: Configure mirrors manually in Settings later
onboarding.mirrorsHint: You can fine-tune mirror settings anytime in Settings > Mirrors.
onboarding.shellDesc: Add CogniaLauncher to your shell PATH so managed tools are available globally.
onboarding.shellHint: Paste this into your shell config file, then restart your terminal. You can also set this up later via Settings > Paths.
onboarding.completeDesc: CogniaLauncher is ready to use. Explore the dashboard or take a quick guided tour.
onboarding.completeHint: Click Finish to start using the app
onboarding.tourSidebarDesc: Access all major sections from here: Dashboard, Environments, Packages, Downloads, and more.
onboarding.tourDashboardDesc: Your overview at a glance. Drag to rearrange widgets or click Customize to add/remove them.
onboarding.tourEnvironmentsDesc: Manage runtime versions for Node.js, Python, Rust, Go, and many more.
onboarding.tourPackagesDesc: Search, install, and update packages from multiple providers in one place.
onboarding.tourCommandPaletteDesc: Press Ctrl+K to quickly search and navigate anywhere in the app.
onboarding.tourSettingsDesc: Configure mirrors, themes, paths, providers, and all other preferences here.

hints.dashboardCustomizeDesc: Click here to add, remove, or rearrange dashboard widgets to match your workflow.
hints.dashboardDragDesc: You can drag widgets to reorder them. Click Edit Layout to enable drag mode.
hints.envVersionSwitcherDesc: Use the toolbar to filter, sort, and search your installed runtime environments.
hints.packagesSearchDesc: Search across all configured providers to find and install packages.
hints.cacheOverviewDesc: Monitor cache usage, verify integrity, and clean up disk space from here.
hints.downloadsConcurrentDesc: Manage active downloads, adjust concurrency settings, and track download history.
hints.settingsMirrorsDesc: Set up package registry mirrors for faster downloads, and manage onboarding preferences.
hints.providersStatusDesc: Check which package managers and environment providers are available on your system.
hints.commandPaletteShortcutDesc: Press Ctrl+K (or Cmd+K on Mac) to open the command palette and quickly navigate anywhere.

go.modTidyDesc: Run go mod tidy to clean up module dependencies

errorPage.title: Something went wrong
errorPage.defaultMessage: An unexpected error occurred. Please try again.

notFoundPage.title: Page Not Found

brew.doctorHealthy: Your system is ready to brew
